intro: Tephroseris sukaczevii, commonly known as the Siberian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the cold climates of Siberia and northern Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in well-drained environments. It has a low-growing habit with lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in late summer. Tephroseris sukaczevii is adapted to harsh climates and is often found in alpine or arctic regions.
